description: Physical properties; fluid statics; Bernoulli equation; fluid kinematics; conservation laws and finite control-volume analysis; conservation laws and differential analysis; inviscid flow; The Navier-Stokes equation and some exact solutions; similitude, dimensional analysis, and modeling; flow in pipes and channels; boundary layer theory; lift and drag.
name: FLUID MECHANICS

values.comments:
This course covers a wide range of topics related to fluid mechanics, including
physical properties; fluid statics and kinematics; the Bernoulli equation; conservation
laws and differential analysis; the Navier-Stokes equation; flow in pipes and channels;
boundary layer theory; and lift and drag.
The course received many positive comments. It was well-structured featuring
applications in the real world and problem solving skills. Students reported that they
learned a lot on fluid dynamics. However, one student indicated that he was still not sure
how the concepts taught in the course applied to various examples.
Students generally considered Dr. Holleran as a great lecturer. One student
complimented his ability to “get across the essentials” and to help students figure out the
things that they need in the field. Another student praised his willingness to help
students.
This course is a requirement for CBE majors and is typically taken by juniors, but
it is recommended to anyone who is interested in chemical engineering.
